page.title: 12Parkland in Swindon
page.content: There are 4 areas of open land in Old Town. The town gardens,Queen's park, the Lawns and Croft woods. The town gardens are kept by 20 gardeners and it has a bowling-green, bandstand, open-air theatre and kiddies playground. On the Lawns are 2 lakes with swans and ducks, large areas of trees and open grassland left fairly wild. A mansion-house stands in the area and was mentioned in the first Domesday Book. Queen's park has a lake and a heated greenhouse with exotic plants. Bluebells cover the ground like a blue mist in Croft woods in the spring. Building is taking place on the edge but there is still a lot of woodland left. Many people walk their dogs there and children play and make dens.
